Comment: The UK Supreme Court took this off the table in the UK. After years of culture wars there they said "a woman is a biological woman", with separate trans rights still in place.  So trans women can't compete in male sports, enter female only group or toilets/changing rooms.     Any kind of compromize or approach perceived as more one sided will never satisfy everyone. It does take some of the Right wing rhetoric off the table though re the 'man/boy' completing in woman/girl sports that you mention.  I wonder why the Right in the USA won't do this, maybe they just like the culture wars to use against the left, involving a relative small minority (voting bloc). Deliberately 'losing' battles on it in legal terms.

Comment: hey, a lot of educators like myself are knee deep in the trenches trying to staunch bleeding wounds with tiny bandaids out here. it's not us. partially it's school boards getting taken over by crackpot conservatives, but especially it's the state-sponsored emphasis on standardized testing. core subject teachers (math, science, english, and generally US history teachers) have to teach to the test, which requires little critical thinking at all, and it's terrifying to watch first hand.   i'm lucky enough to teach AP history which is all critical thinking, but i have to undo so many bad habits in the first six months of class before my kids even start to realize that knowing vocabulary isn't enough, that you need to be able to make an argument and support it with evidence.  vote in school board elections! complain to the state legislatures about standardized testing! we need help!!!

Comment: I'm from the UK and know some different people whose grown up children have moved there.  They report it's lovely and it's a great idea to raise children as free as possible from social media.      Every approach has it's pros and cons but a childhood without  malevolent social media where at all possible has got to be better. Free of  its bullying, it's damaging impossible images to live up to. It's algorithms as you say.      Also,  Gun violence in Aus has  decreased to an incomparable level compared to America.  Stemming way back from the 1996 Port Arthur massacre and its subsequent reforms. Not just homicides down but suicides by guns too. In the UK, I never worry about getting shot or the need to defend myself. It doesn't mean there aren't possible dangers, e.g. knife crime, but gun power is so much different in its devastation.  It sounds almost bizarre to have a childhood free of social media now, but it's happening there. Children will of course find ways, but when access to anything is limited it usually decreases its possibilites exponentially, like the gun reforms in Aus did.     I agree with you, if you can make that move do it for sure. In terms of raising children it doesn't even seem a question looking at what's happening in America.
Author: True_Paper_3830

Comment: Also a student in their 30s.  It’s mind blowing how bad some classes can be when it comes to learning new things.  It’s not even a left vs right difference… it’s just everyone seems incapable of challenging themselves and pushing themselves to learn the course materials on their own without a teacher forcing them to attend class and hand-holding these “adults” through every lesson.  I’ve had multiple classes that have had content cut because it took to long to teach the scheduled sections, classes where I and maybe 2-3 others out of a class of 40-50 would participate and try to answer questions, group projects where the other students do nothing or just use AI, and just a general lack of community and group effort to learn.  Obviously there’s definitely some bright kids out there and kids who are motivated to learn but back in my day when I went through college the first time (12 years ago). Most students seemed engaged and were able to teach themselves and help each other.  Now it just feels like such a rarity to see a kid fresh out of highschool who’s motivated to not only learn but help those around them and engage with the instructors.
Author: McMatey_Pirate
